issue.subject: Remove PostgreSQL support
issue.description:
On February 12th 2016 meeting, Technical Committee proposes to remove PostgreSQL support.
Reasons are:
* There is no known user of easySDI running PGSQL
* PGSQL install and updates are not tested in easySDI
* There is (or was) Joomla problems in PGSQL support. We cannot guarantee that current Joomla version runs properly on PGSQL
* Third party software is very rarely supported on PGSQL, so a user of Joomla/easySDI on PGSQL would not be able to take advantage of market modules/plugins/components.

custom_fields.name: Functional impact
custom_fields.value:
* End of support of PostgreSQL in easySDI.
* Improve easySDI global quality by only delivering tested software.

journals.notes: PSC agree with laying aside PGSQL support in easySDI solution.
SC (Xavier, Laurent, Bruno) has voted for such removal

I have looked up for postgresql in code... (things like @if(JFactory::getDbo()->name == 'postgresql'@)
=> didn't find any, so the only thing to do is : remove install + update SQL files, then adapt ant build for xml generation
